body_html:
my guess is that a localization setting on the machine is set to use comma as the decimal separator. We are probably using a locale-specific function to re-serialize the floating point value.

Is that possibly what is happening on your machine? If so, I can track down which proto-text serialization is doing this and try to fix it there.
body_text:
my guess is that a localization setting on the machine is set to use comma as the decimal separator.  We are probably using a locale-specific function to re-serialize the floating point value.
Is that possibly what is happening on your machine?  If so, I can track down which proto-text serialization is doing this and try to fix it there.
body:
my guess is that a localization setting on the machine is set to use comma as the decimal separator.  We are probably using a locale-specific function to re-serialize the floating point value.

Is that possibly what is happening on your machine?  If so, I can track down which proto-text serialization is doing this and try to fix it there.
